alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 11:16AM EST until January 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. .Rainfall amounts from 2 to 3 inches fell over the past 36 hours in the basin of the North Fork of the Edisto. This will produce minor flooding along the river. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor flooding occurs along the boardwalk at Edisto Gardens. Downstream from the Highway 301 bridge, some roads off Chiquita street near the river begin to flood. At 10.0 feet, Farmland and lowlands along Highway 301 near Orangeburg become flooded at stages above 10 ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 8.1 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
